solution_line_template: If Val currently has {initial_nickels} nickels and finds twice as many nickels as she has in her older brother's treasure box, she will have {found_nickels_multiplier}*{initial_nickels}={found_nickels} more nickels.
The total number of nickels she'll have is {found_nickels}+{initial_nickels}=<<{found_nickels}+{initial_nickels}={total_nickels}>>{total_nickels}
Since nickel is worth ${nickel_value}, the value of the nickels Val is having is {total_nickels}*{nickel_value}=$<<{total_nickels}*{nickel_value}={total_nickels_value}>>{total_nickels_value}

Val had three times as many dimes as nickels before she found the {found_nickels} new nickels, a total of {dimes_multiplier}*{initial_nickels}=<<{dimes_multiplier}*{initial_nickels}={dimes_before}>>{dimes_before} dimes
Since a dime has a value of ${dime_value}, the value of the dimes that Val has is {dimes_before}*${dime_value}=$<<{dimes_before}*{dime_value}={total_dimes_value}>>{total_dimes_value}
Together, the value of the dimes and nickels Val has is worth ${total_dimes_value}+${total_nickels_value}=$<<{total_dimes_value}+{total_nickels_value}={total_value}>>{total_value}
